channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Heavy snow blankets parts of the U.S. during busy holiday travel weekend
item.description: Frigid air was expected to move over the eastern third of the U.S. by Monday, while heavy snow was forecast to cause hazards in the Great Lakes, Plains and Midwest regions.
item.content:encoded:
Frigid air was expected to move over the eastern third of the U.S. by Monday, while heavy snow was forecast to cause hazards in the Great Lakes, Plains and Midwest regions.

(Image credit: Cara Anna)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: FIFA should pay workers harmed in building World Cup venues, its committee report says
item.description: The report said the main responsibility lay with the workers' direct employers and the Qatari government, but noted that "a credible argument can be made" that FIFA played a role as well.
item.content:encoded:
The report said the main responsibility lay with the workers' direct employers and the Qatari government, but noted that "a credible argument can be made" that FIFA played a role as well.

(Image credit: Francois Mori)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Trump picks longtime ally Kash Patel to replace current FBI director
item.description: The president-elect plans to replace current FBI Director Christopher Wray with Patel, a close ally of the president-elect and former national security aide, has berated the Justice Department and the news media.
item.content:encoded:
The president-elect plans to replace current FBI Director Christopher Wray with Patel, a close ally of the president-elect and former national security aide, has berated the Justice Department and the news media.

(Image credit: Ross D. Franklin)
item.dc:creator: Carrie Johnson

item.title: How a Syrian rebel group pulled off its stunning seizure of Aleppo
item.description: Over a few days, rebel fighters in northern Syria have launched incursions into several major cities with little resistance from government troops.
item.content:encoded:
Over a few days, rebel fighters in northern Syria have launched incursions into several major cities with little resistance from government troops.

(Image credit: Omar Albam)
item.dc:creator: Willem Marx

item.title: World Central Kitchen workers killed by Israeli airstrike, Gaza health ministry says
item.description: An Israeli airstrike hit a car in the Gaza Strip on Saturday, killing five people, including at least three employees with the food aid charity. World Central Kitchen said that it was "urgently seeking more details."
item.content:encoded:
An Israeli airstrike hit a car in the Gaza Strip on Saturday, killing five people, including at least three employees with the food aid charity. World Central Kitchen said that it was "urgently seeking more details."

(Image credit: Bashar Taleb)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman

item.title: How to solve the Gen Z social isolation problem? She tried surfing and it worked
item.description: Young people today spend nearly 1,000 fewer hours per year hanging out with friends in person than they did 20 years ago. Some solutions for the loneliness epidemic are coming from unlikely places.
item.content:encoded:
Young people today spend nearly 1,000 fewer hours per year hanging out with friends in person than they did 20 years ago. Some solutions for the loneliness epidemic are coming from unlikely places.

(Image credit: Intrsxtn Surf)
item.dc:creator: Katia Riddle

item.title: Opinion: The life and work of Seuk Kim, pilot and animal rescuer
item.description: NPR's Scott Simon remembers Seuk Kim, a volunteer animal rescue pilot who died in a crash earlier this week, transporting several dogs.
item.content:encoded:
NPR's Scott Simon remembers Seuk Kim, a volunteer animal rescue pilot who died in a crash earlier this week, transporting several dogs.

(Image credit: Petty Officer 1st Class Lucas Loe)
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: SunFed cucumbers and Costco eggs recalled for potential salmonella contamination
item.description: Cucumbers shipped to the U.S. and Canada, and organic eggs sold in 25 Costco stores in five southern U.S. states, were recalled this week for potential salmonella contamination.
item.content:encoded:
Cucumbers shipped to the U.S. and Canada, and organic eggs sold in 25 Costco stores in five southern U.S. states, were recalled this week for potential salmonella contamination.

(Image credit: Jacquelyn Martin)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Reporter Journal: A sunrise trek through wild solitude in New York City
item.description: New York City is home to more than eight million people but NPR's Brian Mann mapped out an urban hike through solitude and parkland wildness.
item.content:encoded:
New York City is home to more than eight million people but NPR's Brian Mann mapped out an urban hike through solitude and parkland wildness.

(Image credit: Brian Mann)
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: Ireland headed for coalition government, exit poll suggests
item.description: An exit poll in Ireland's parliamentary election released late Friday suggests the three biggest parties have won roughly equal shares and the country is headed for another coalition government.
item.content:encoded:
An exit poll in Ireland's parliamentary election released late Friday suggests the three biggest parties have won roughly equal shares and the country is headed for another coalition government.

(Image credit: Peter Morrison)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
